actions.text: Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 3596 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit with or without instructions. Points of order against consideration of the bill for failure to comply with clause 8 of rule XXI are waived. It shall be in order to consider as an original bill for the purpose of amendment under the five-minute rule the amendment in the nature of a substitute recommended by the Committee on Banking, Finance and Urban Affairs now printed in the bill. Points of order against the committee amendment in the nature of a substitute for failure to comply with clause 7 of rule XVI are waived. Measure will be considered read. Specified amendments are in order. Consideration of amendments made in order by the rule shall be governed by the conditions set forth in the report of the Committee on Rules accompa...
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 102-867, by Ms. Slaughter.
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 199.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
The previous question was ordered without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

official_title: Providing for the consideration of the bill (H.R. 3596) to amend the Fair Credit Reporting Act to assure the completeness and accuracy of consumer information maintained by credit reporting agencies, to better inform consumers of their rights under the Act, and to improve enforcement, and for other purposes.

summary.text: Sets forth the rule for the consideration of H.R. 3596 (consumer credit reporting).

titles.title: Providing for the consideration of the bill (H.R. 3596) to amend the Fair Credit Reporting Act to assure the completeness and accuracy of consumer information maintained by credit reporting agencies, to better inform consumers of their rights under the Act, and to improve enforcement, and for other purposes.
